name: Safety Net Champions
title: Strong Social Safety Net Programs
description: In 2015, Gambia's social safety net programs accounted for 55.15% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, showcasing a robust support system for its citizens.

name: Child Labor Alarm
title: High Child Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2015, a staggering 94.65% of economically active children aged 7-14 in Gambia were employed in agriculture, highlighting a significant challenge in child labor practices.

name: Family Workforce
title: Prevalence of Unpaid Child Family Workers
description: In 2015, 94.62% of children in employment aged 7-14 were unpaid family workers in Gambia, indicating a reliance on child labor within family units.

name: Export Powerhouse
title: Dominance in Exporting to Low- and Middle-Income Economies
description: In 2023, 97.38% of Gambia's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies outside its region, demonstrating a strong international trade presence.

name: European Trade Focus
title: Significant Exports to Europe & Central Asia
description: In 2023, 96.95% of Gambia's merchandise exports were sent to low- and middle-income economies in Europe & Central Asia, emphasizing its strategic trade relationships.

name: Work-Only Youth
title: High Percentage of Children Working Only
description: In 2015, 56.63% of children in employment aged 7-14 were engaged in work only, without attending school, highlighting a critical area for educational improvement.

name: Digital Transparency Boost
title: Leading in Digital Public Services Transparency
description: In 2024, Gambia achieved a remarkable score of 8.33 in digital public services and transparency for business entry, showcasing its commitment to digital governance.

name: Food Production Challenge
title: Struggling with Food Production
description: Gambia's food production index stood at 71.08 in 2022, indicating a significant challenge in meeting food production needs compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

name: Child Labor Concerns
title: High Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, 43.37% of children aged 7-14 in Gambia were involved in employment, with a notable 44.05% of females and 42.84% of males engaged in study and work.

name: Service Export Struggles
title: Low Contribution of Communications and Computer Services
description: In 2023, communications and computer services accounted for only 1.12% of Gambia's service exports, highlighting a need for diversification in service sectors.

name: Utility Regulation Hurdles
title: Challenges in Utility Service Regulations
description: With a score of 36.46 in 2024, Gambia faces challenges in the quality of regulations governing utility services, impacting business operations.

name: Business Location Woes
title: Low Business Location Appeal
description: Gambia's overall score for business location was 33.42 in 2024, indicating room for improvement in attracting businesses.

name: Labor Market Struggles
title: Labor Market Challenges
description: In 2024, Gambia's labor market scored 49.22, reflecting ongoing challenges in labor dynamics and employment opportunities.

name: Social Safety Net Gaps
title: Limited Social Safety Net Coverage
description: In 2015, only 0.55% of the richest quintile in Gambia were covered by social safety net programs, indicating a gap in social protection.
